terms.definition: The specific laws of a particular jurisdiction that will be used to interpret and enforce the contract.
A formal phrase indicating the parties are signing the document to show their agreement to its terms.
A contract for services where the person providing the work is self-employed rather than an employee.
A formal word, often used with 'THEREFORE,' to introduce the main actions or agreements of a contract after the background information.
A formal word used to mean 'for that reason' or 'as a result'.
A formal word introducing background facts or reasons for the agreement.
Someone legally authorized to act on behalf of another person or entity.
Meant to be kept private and not shared with others.
Refers to the initial date specified at the beginning of the document.
Through immediate actions or through actions that have a less obvious or secondary connection.
To reveal or share any information that was mentioned previously in the document.

terms.term: during the term of this Agreement or at any time thereafter
terms.definition: Throughout the period this contract is active, or at any point after it ends.
A person hired and directed by another party to perform work in exchange for wages or salary.
The parties have signed and officially brought this contract into effect.

terms.term: governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of
terms.definition: This agreement will be interpreted and enforced based on the specific laws of a particular place.

terms.term: in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein
terms.definition: The agreement is legally binding because each party is giving up something or promising something in exchange for the other's promises.
A party participating in a temporary business undertaking with another party, sharing risks and profits.

terms.term: made and entered into as of
terms.definition: The specific date on which the agreement officially begins or became effective.
A person or entity involved in a joint venture or business with shared responsibilities and profits.
The primary or main location where a company's operations are conducted.
The work or task has been finished to an acceptable standard or as required.
Will begin or start.
Only one party is entirely accountable or liable for something.
The contract ended before its originally scheduled completion date.
Confidential business information that gives a company a competitive advantage.

terms.term: upon providing thirty (30) days written notice
terms.definition: After giving a written notification 30 days in advance.

terms.term: without giving effect to any choice of law or conflict of law provisions
terms.definition: The designated laws will apply directly, without considering rules that might point to the laws of a different place.
